properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Drumborg, Mount Richmond. 
  • There is a bushfire at 17 Km West Of Heywood that is under control.
  • Firefighters are patrolling the fire.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 14/03/2025 09:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice is being issued for Portland, Heywood and surrounds.

  • Smoke from fires in the area is drifting across Portland, Heywood and surrounding areas. 
  • The smoke may aggravate existing heart and lung conditions and cause irritated eyes, coughing and wheezing.
Smoke can affect people's health. You should be aware of the health impacts of smoke on you and others.
What you should do:
  • Your nose is an excellent smoke detector. If you can smell smoke, take the necessary precautions to protect your health. You can self-assess the air quality near you using: https://www.epa.vic.gov.au/for-community/environmental-information/air-quality/smoke/smoke-your-health.
  • Check EPA Airwatch for changes to air quality throughout the day and follow the advice provided.
Take action to reduce your exposure to smoke and protect your health: 
  • People who are more sensitive to smoke are those with a heart or lung condition, including asthma; people over the age of 65 years; infants and children; and pregnant women. 
  • If you are sensitive to smoke, limit prolonged or heavy physical activity. Where possible, try to stay indoors. 
  • If you have a heart or lung conditions, take your medication as prescribed by your doctor. 
  • If you are asthmatic, follow your asthma plan and carry reliever medication with you. 
  • For more information on smoke and your health, visit the Better Health Channel. If you are concerned about symptoms, call Nurse on Call on 1300 606 024 or see your doctor. 
  • If you or anyone in your care has trouble breathing or tightness in the chest, call Triple Zero (000) for an ambulance.
Impacts in your area:
  • It may be smoky or hazy in your area. 
  • Road travel may be hazardous due to low visibility associated with smoke.
  • Environment Protection Authority is monitoring air quality in the area.
This message was issued by Environment Protection Authority.

The next update is expected by 14/03/2025 05:50 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Euroa, Violet Town, Longwood, Ruffy, Avenel and Strathbogie.
  • An outbreak of H7N8 avian influenza (bird flu) is confirmed at four poultry properties at Euroa. 
  • This warning is relevant for all bird owners including poultry producers, bird keepers and pet bird owners. 
  • The area impacted by restrictions is east of the Goulburn Valley Freeway for Strathbogie Shire.
  • This Community Information replaces the Community Information issued on 5 March. 
Things you should know about avian influenza: 
  • H7 bird flu is a highly contagious disease that infects chickens, ducks, geese, turkeys, guinea fowl, quail, pheasants and ostriches. Many species of wild birds, including waterfowl and seabirds, can also carry the virus. 
  • This is different from the H5N1 bird flu strain impacting wildlife in other countries around the world. Australia remains free from H5 bird flu.
  • Movement controls are in place and the infected properties have been quarantined.  These controls prohibit the movement of birds, equipment and products, including manure and eggs, within and out of the control area and restricted area until further notice.  
  • All poultry owners with more than 50 birds in the restricted area are required to house their birds. This applies to the area between Euroa and Longwood.
  • Recreational game bird hunting is not allowed in the restricted or control areas. This includes duck, stubble quail and introduced game bird hunting. 
  • Moving game bird carcasses and any equipment associated with game bird hunting into, out of or through the restricted and control areas is prohibited unless under a movement permit. 
  • You can find more information about movement controls and quarantine here: agriculture.vic.gov.au/avianinfluenza.
  • To stop the spread of H7 bird flu, birds on infected properties are being destroyed. 
  • Eggs and poultry products from supermarkets are safe to consume.  
All bird owners should regularly check their birds. Unexplained illness or deaths in your birds should be notified to your local vet or by calling the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226.

If you are located within the warning area and you own birds, you must follow all movement controls.
What you should do:
  • Follow the movement controls. Check the Agriculture Victoria website or call 1800 226 226 for detailed information on what you can and canâ€™t do in the restricted and control areas.  
If you own birds: 
  • Do not move your birds, eggs, chicken manure or poultry equipment into, within, or out of the control or restricted areas. 
  • Bird owners should regularly check their birds and immediately report any sudden death or unusual signs of disease to their local vet or call 1800 226 226. 
  • Check the Agriculture Victoria website - agriculture.vic.gov.au/avianinfluenza - or phone 1800 226 226 for details on movement controls. 
To help prevent the spread of disease to your birds you should: 
  • Restrict contact between pet birds, poultry and wild birds. 
  • Prevent access by wild birds to food and water sources for your birds. 
  • Keep equipment and yards or aviaries clean. 
  • Limit visitors to your birds. 
  • Bird owners should wash their hands before and after handling birds. 
Check for signs of avian influenza:
  • Signs of the disease in birds may include: Sudden death. Birds with difficulties breathing, such as coughing, sneezing, or rasping.  
  • Swelling and purple discolouration of the head, comb, wattles and neck. 
  • Rapid drop in eating, drinking and egg production. 
  • Ruffled feathers, dopiness, closed eyes. 
  • Diarrhea. 
  • Occasionally, nervous symptoms. 
How avian influenza spreads:
  • Avian influenza can be spread to other animals by movement of eggs, birds, people handling birds, vehicles and equipment between farms, and by clothing, footwear, aerosols, water, feed, litter, wild birds, biting insects and vermin. 
Protecting your health: 
  • Eggs and poultry products from supermarkets are safe to consume.
  • You can find more information here: https://www2.health.vic.gov.au/public-health/infectious-diseases/disease-information-advice/avian-flu
This message was issued by Agriculture Victoria.

The next update is expected by 19/03/2025 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: COMMUNITY INFORMATION - ANIMAL DISEASE - Stay Informed Incident Location: Euroa Issue Date: Sunday 09 March 2025, 11:25 am Next Update: Wednesday 19 March 2025, 05:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/37090/moreinfo This Community Information message is being issued for Euroa, Violet Town, Longwood, Ruffy, Avenel and Strathbogie. - An outbreak of H7N8 avian influenza (bird flu) is confirmed at four poultry properties at Euroa. - This warning is relevant for all bird owners including poultry producers, bird keepers and pet bird owners. - The area impacted by restrictions is east of the Goulburn Valley Freeway for Strathbogie Shire. - This Community Information replaces the Community Information issued on 5 March. Things you should know about avian influenza: - H7 bird flu is a highly contagious disease that infects chickens, ducks, geese, turkeys, guinea fowl, quail, pheasants and ostriches. Many species of wild birds, including waterfowl and seabirds, can also carry the virus. - This is different from the H5N1 bird flu strain impacting wildlife in other countries around the world. Australia remains free from H5 bird flu. - Movement controls are in place and the infected properties have been quarantined. These controls prohibit the movement of birds, equipment and products, including manure and eggs, within and out of the control area and restricted area until further notice. - All poultry owners with more than 50 birds in the restricted area are required to house their birds. This applies to the area between Euroa and Longwood. - Recreational game bird hunting is not allowed in the restricted or control areas. This includes duck, stubble quail and introduced game bird hunting. - Moving game bird carcasses and any equipment associated with game bird hunting into, out of or through the restricted and control areas is prohibited unless under a movement permit. - You can find more information about movement controls and quarantine here: agriculture.vic.gov.au/avianinfluenza. - To stop the spread of H7 bird flu, birds on infected properties are being destroyed. - Eggs and poultry products from supermarkets are safe to consume. All bird owners should regularly check their birds. Unexplained illness or deaths in your birds should be notified to your local vet or by calling the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226. If you are located within the warning area and you own birds, you must follow all movement controls.

There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

The next update is expected by 14/03/2025 03:50 pm or as the situation changes.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Jericho - Park Road. 
  • The bushfire at Park Road Jericho under control.
  • Firefighters remain in the area monitoring this fire and strengthening containment lines.
The Australian Alpine Walking Track is open via a temporarily detour using the Upper Thomson Road. Signage is in place indicating this re-route.  

The following roads and tracks remain closed:
  • Trig Point Track
  • Cream Can Hill Track
  • Upper Thomson Road
  • Mt Gregory Track
  • Sucklings Road
  • Basalt Hill Track
  • Park Road
  • Section of Thomson-Jordan Road between Park Road and Basalt Hill Track
Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.   Check parks.vic.gov.au/coc-listing and ffm.vic.gov.au for Forest and Park closures.

This message replaces the Advice message issued at 11.00 am 2/03/25.   
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.  


This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 24/03/2025 03:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

This Community Information message is being issued for Buninyong. 
  • The bushfire at Mount Buninyong remains under control.
  • Firefighters will remain on scene to patrol the fire ground.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • This Community Information replaces the Community Information issued at 11:03 am, Monday 10 March.
  • Yendon No 2 Road is now open to traffic, at reduced speeds.
  • Mount Buninyong Road at Blackberry Lane will remain closed.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 17/03/2025 10:00 am or as the situation changes.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Jilpanger, Clear Lake, Miga Lake, Noradjuha
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire at 11Km N Of Douglas. 
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice message issued 13 March at 3.54pm. 
  • The fire is active in the northern half of the reserve. 
People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities, and continue to monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
Impacts in your area:
  • Emergency services remain in the area.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Billabong, Howitt Plains, Arbuckle, Reynard, Tamboritha, Wongungarra, Wonnangatta
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Arbuckle, Billabong, Howitt Plains, Reynard, Tamboritha, Wongungarra, Wonnangatta.
  • There is a bushfire at Wonnangatta Valley that is not yet under control.
  • Rising temperatures may lead to increased fire activity.
  • The fire area has been mapped at 3,064 hectares.  
  • This Advice replaces the Advice message issued at 11:20am 13/03/2025.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • Firefighters continue to monitor and contain the fire spread.
  • Aircraft will be operating in the area.

All access to the Wonnangatta Valley is closed.  

The following roads, tracks and visitor sites are closed:
  • Zeka Spur Track
  • Herne Spur Track
  • Wonnangatta Track between Herne Spur and Rileys Track
  • Humphrey River Track south of Wombat Range
  • Howitt Road 
  • Bryces Gorge and Guys Hut
  • Caledonia River Track
  • Butcher Country Track
  • King Billy Track
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 15/03/2025 11:30 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Breakaway Creek, Lake Condah, Macarthur.
  • There is a bushfire at 10 Km Wsw Of Macarthur  that is not yet under control.
  • Firefighters, with firefighting vehicles and aircraft, are working to bring this fire under control.
  • Budj Bim National Park remains closed to all campers and visitors. 
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued at 7:22PM 13 March 2025.
  • There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services are working in the area.
  • Increased Smoke will be visible from local communities and roads.
  • The following roads are closed: Brians Rd, and all roads in Budj Bim National Park. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 14/03/2025 06:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Boho, Marraweeney, Warrenbayne, Baddaginnie, Balmattum, Boho South
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Baddaginnie, Balmattum, Boho, Boho South, Marraweeney, Warrenbayne. 
  • There is a bushfire in the Strathbogie State Forest. 
  • Firefighters are continuing to work on and patrol the fire. 
  • Emergency stabilisation works have commenced, heavy machinery is still present and working.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • This community information replaces the community notification issued at 9.47am Tuesday March 11.
  • Reminder that roads and tracks in the State Forest are closed to the public. There are also speed restrictions in place on Upper Boho Road and Boho Church Road.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

This will be the final message issued for this fire unless the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Rubicon, Taggerty, Buxton.
  • There is a bushfire North-East of Sugarloaf Saddle within the Cathedral Range State Park that is not yet under control.
  • Smoke may be visible from the Cathedral Range, campsites and surrounding areas. 
  • Firefighters, heavy machinery and aircraft are responding to this fire.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 14/03/2025 08:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: 4Km North East of Buxton
Issue Date: Friday 14 March 2025, 09:59 am
Next Update: Friday 14 March 2025, 08:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/37206/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Rubicon, Taggerty, Buxton.
- There is a bushfire North-East of Sugarloaf Saddle within the Cathedral Range State Park that is not yet under control.
- Smoke may be visible from the Cathedral Range, campsites and surrounding areas. 
- Firefighters, heavy machinery and aircraft are responding to this fire.


There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Buragwonduc, Crookayan, Glencairn, Glenfalloch, Licola, Licola North, Nap Nap Marra, Sargood, Worrowing, Wrathung, Wrixon, Koorool, Tamboritha
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Buragwonduc, Crookayan, Glencairn, Glenfalloch, Koorool, Licola, Licola North, Nap Nap Marra, Sargood, Tamboritha, Worrowing, Wrathung, Wrixon.

  • The bushfire at Mt Margaret Walking Track in the Alpine National Park is not yet under control.
  • The fire remains active and is 5624 hectares.
  • Firefighters and aircraft continue to work on limiting the spread of the fire.
  • Heavy firefighting machinery and large vehicles are operating in the area on main roads and forest tracks.  
  • This Advice replaces the Advice Message issued at 3:23pm on 12/03/2025
There is currently no threat to local communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor weather conditions and warnings.

If the situation changes, campgrounds and roads may be closed at short notice.  Visitors should stay informed, monitor weather conditions and warnings, and remain ready and able to move away.  
What you should do: 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Reduce speed and drive to the conditions, especially on narrow winding roads.
  • Watch for emergency response teams and follow their directions.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters, aircraft and plant machinery will remain working in the area.
 
Park Closures
  • Avon Wilderness Park is currently closed due to bushfire. 
  • Areas within the southern section of the Alpine National Park are also closed due to bushfire. 

The following Roads, tracks and visitor sites are closed;
  • Howitt Road at Arbuckle Junction - due to the Wonnangatta Valley fire
  • The Tali Karng walking Track network 
  • Chromite Mine Track
  • B1 Track and B2 Track
  • Moroka Range Track 
  • Burgoyne track east of the Licola Road
  • Mt Margaret Track 
  • Mt Margaret Walking Track
  • Millers Hut
  • Nyimba Camp
  • Mt Wellington Track
  • Hickeys Creek Track and Hickeys Creek Track - East 
  • Avon Track
Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.   Check parks.vic.gov.au/coc-listing and ffm.vic.gov.au for Forest and Park closures. 

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 14/03/2025 03:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Eildon. 
  • The bushfire 5Km South-Southeast of Eildon is under control.
  • Firefighters will continue to patrol this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities, Lake Eildon and roads. 
  • This Community Information replaces the Advice issued at 6.00pm 13 March 2025.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

This will be the final message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
